job_title: Call Center Representative in Fresno, CA
pros: Health, dental, and vision costs were very low for employees and their families. Great PTO accrual rate once you completed 2 years of work.
cons: Never saw the CEO Colleen Curtis unless there is a camera around. She only shows up when there is some sort of press conference. When she does show up, she always has an attitude of superiority. She treats the company like its her kingdom and employees and patients were just peons beneath her.

review_title: Great place to work as a therapist
job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW in Selma, CA
pros: Hands-off management that's nonetheless supportive and accommodating. Attractive facilities, friendly environment. medical staff on hand. Great benefits. great pay plus bonuses. Opportunity to work with clients with a wide range of diagnoses.
cons: Can get busy. Dearth of mental health resources in the Central Valley.

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW in Fresno, CA
pros: Salary, nice coworkers, some new clinic buildings, large company
cons: Repetative work, no case reviews, no control of schedule, no opportunity for advancement

pros: Amazing people to work with. Great pay and benefits.
cons: There is not much to complain about working at United Health Centers.

pros: Good benefits: Medical/Dental Insurance/PTO, 401k...Etc
cons: Not applicable. Really great company

pros: Bonus pay Christmas fund 1hr lunch
cons: Slow pt flow. No growth

pros: The insurance benefits were incredible.  I don't know of any other company that has a $250 deductible per person and $750 family maximum.  It's a 90/10 coinsurance and copay is $20. Costs for entire family maxes out at $175 per month.  Employee only is $28/month.  BTW, did I mention that this is for medical, dental, and vision combined?
cons: Hours were long and not family-friendly.  Very few employees are salaried and its tough to move up.  There's two set of rules......one for them up in top management and one for the peons.  Wages were not great but the insurance help make up for it.

pros: Benefits can not be beaten. They are great and helpful when you have a large family. Quarterly bonuses are great and totally with it alone. Team atmosphere and growing company
cons: It takes awhile to learn procedure and processes since it is pretty hands off the first year. Although if you are a go getter you can pick up different areas of the organization quickly.

cons:

Not many options to move
